alert.note: Alert for Butts; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Spalding; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 1:28AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Spalding, southeastern Meriwether, eastern Pike, northwestern Monroe, Upson, southwestern Butts, northern Talbot, north central Taylor and Lamar Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 128 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from East Griffin to Woodland, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Griffin, Thomaston, Barnesville, Zebulon, Manchester, Milner, Woodland, Yatesville, Orchard Hill, Meansville, Aldora, Sunset Village, Lincoln Park, The Rock, East Griffin, Atwater, Sprewell Bluff State Park, Logtown, Blount and Sunnyside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Butts; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Spalding; Talbot; Taylor; Upson
